revised_title: NGF Prevents Monocular Deprivation Effects in Rat Visual Cortex
tldr: The study found that supplying nerve growth factor (NGF) to monocularly deprived rats during the critical period prevented the effects of monocular deprivation on visual acuity and ocular dominance distribution in the rat visual cortex. This suggests that NGF plays a crucial role in maintaining normal visual development and cortical binocularity.
